page.title: 06CREEL FISHING FROM SCORAIG
page.content:
CREEL FISHING FROM SCORAIG
THERE IS ONE CREEL FISHERMAN LIVING ON SCORAIG.HE HAS A 26FOOT BOAT,DIESEL POWERED.HE USES A MECHANICAL HAULER AND IS EQUIPPED WITH ECHO SOUNDER AND VHF RADIO. HE GOES OUT 5 DAYS A WEEK, WORKING 10 FLEETS OF 50 CREELS.EACH FLEET IS MARKED BY A BUOY AT EACH END. AS LITTLE LOCH BROOM IS OVERFISHED,HE FISHES MAINLY IN THE MINCH.IN AUTUMN HE FISHES FOR LOBSTER.NORMALLY HE WORKS ALONE BUT DURING SCHOOL HOLIDAYS HE OFTEN HAS A CREW. AFTER HAULING THE PRAWNS HE TAKES THEM TO THE JETTY AT BADLUARACH.THERE HE WEIGHS THEM AND LABELS THEIR WEIGHT.LATER A LORRY COMES AND TAKES THEM TO GAIRLOCH WHERE THEY ARE PROCESSED.
